DataElement.preferredName: Comorbidity Diseases and Disorders Prior Transplant Conditioning Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not there is a coexistence of two or more pathologic processes with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms prior to the administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Comorbidity Diseases and Disorders Prior Transplant Conditioning Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the coexistence of two or more pathologic processes with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms prior to the administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The coexistence of two or more disease processes.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: The coexistence of two or more disease processes.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition:
Earlier in time or order.:Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy,
to a transplant.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection).
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unk ND NA Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes, no, unknown, not done or not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Done Not Applicable Indicator
